body_html:
@soumith Is there any way to work with negative indices at the moment, like in Torch7?

th> input = torch.randn(3,64,64)
                                                                      [0.0023s]
th> test = input[{{}, {1, -2}, {1, -2}}]
                                                                      [0.0001s]
th> print(test) -- Works
body_text:
@soumith Is there any way to work with negative indices at the moment, like in Torch7?
th> input = torch.randn(3,64,64)
                                                                      [0.0023s]
th> test = input[{{}, {1, -2}, {1, -2}}]
                                                                      [0.0001s]
th> print(test) -- Works
body:
@soumith Is there any way to work with negative indices at the moment, like in Torch7?


```
th> input = torch.randn(3,64,64)
                                                                      [0.0023s]
th> test = input[{{}, {1, -2}, {1, -2}}]
                                                                      [0.0001s]
th> print(test) -- Works
```
